availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Rogers (Bath County, KY, farmer & private Bath Co Rangers & First Reg Cap Guards)

body.p: Bath County, Kentucky, soldier. Bath County native. Son of John Rogers and Eliza A. Rogers. Married to Frances "Frankie" Stewart Rogers in Bath County on September 15, 1854. Father of Eliza Rogers, Joseph Rogers, and Hezekiah Rogers. Student in Bath County in 1850. Served in Captain Bussey’s Bath County Rangers as a private from December 11, 1863, to April 1, 1864. Served in the First Regiment Capital Guards, Frankfort Battalion, as a private from May 1, 1864, to February 6, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, District 1, p. 76A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, Fox Springs, p. 420B.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1914), KDLA, Film # 994027-994058: Bath County Marriages, 1854, p. 6 of 42 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 760, 888.
